values: Many wonderful cards from Valery Shimanovsky, P.O. Box 804, Nizhekamsk, Tatarstan, Russia, 423578. Also an add-and-pass card labeled "MY CONTEMPORARY". I will be sending blanks of this card in my returns to the Goddess Card contributors. (Just a heads up . . . . ) Thanks, Valery!
From Michael L. Goodman in West Jordon, Utah, comes this lovely collage. See his work at: www.oldlibraryman.blogspot.com

So much mail, so little time - here are the 4 latest contributions to the Goddess Mail Art Project: Ivan Zemtsov, in Yoshkar-Ola Russia has a new projcet, http://www.runningmailart.blogspot.com. and I am so happy to see my dear friend, Alyonka, as a Goddess - wonderful cards and envelope, Ivan - thank you: and from Serse Luigetti in Perugia, Italy, comes cards, goodies, and this Goddess, thank you Serse! From Alexeeva Natalia in Kiriat-Hain, Israel, this lovely Goddess. I tried to connect to her blog, http://blogs.ru/mailgallereyss/ but it didn't work - if someone has the correct url, send it along in a comment, thanks! and finally, this from DeVillo Sloan in Auburn NY - thanks, Sloan!
Indeed very snappy mail art, in a nicely packaged plastic sleeve, along with nine very hot ATC's! Bog at: http://snappyservice.blogspot.com thanks, Snappy! Returns to go out this summer.

Tatiana (aka Matata) sent all this lovely mail art, including 9 ATC's, a collage, a decorated envelope, and an announcement for two mail calls in Tatarstan, "Sviyazhsk, Renaissance of the City", and "Bulgar, Coming Back to the Hole Sources." I especially like the way she put the stamps on the envelope. Here it all is!
This arrived as one large 8.5 x 11 card, blank back - a journal entry about the Goddess, very intriguing!
comes this lovely monotype:
These beautiful cards came today from Karen Champlin in Highland Park, IL. Great work, Karen!

This is an add and pass Goddess card from Tania Krosse in Stockholm - there were several websites written on the front, but none of them seemed to work. If anyone has contact information for Tania, please let me know -- thanks!
Maybe not Goddess Art, but too nice not to share here, from Cheryl Penn in South Africa:

six Goddess cards in a series, to trade - thanks Anke! and her mail call:
Nine artist trading cards from Valentine Mark Herman, www.val-herman-art.eu. Hooray for the Goddess and her inspiration!
From Dewi in Toronto, 6 awesome hand-drawn images of Goddesses with catchy titles, thanks Dewi!

I am still here! I got a new piece in the mail today from close by Colorado Springs. Thanks Samantha!
Anyone who sends mail art, I will post it here. The Goddess Lives!

oh my oh my - when I get a mailbox full of such amazingly wonderful work, my jaw just drops. These gorgeous collages are from David Koepp in Chicago - thank you so very much, what a blessing these creations are.
These are colorful hand painted bits of silk mounted on heavy paper - very beautiful! I would be so grateful if anyone can translate this for me.
This is from Guivry France, from Ambassade D'Utopia, someone simply named "E".

We are moving next friday, so I have not been caught up here - here are the latest. and note new mailing address for Goddess Art: Emily Townsend/Artstation 148 Monmouth Street Hightstown, NJ 08520 USA thanks! I have been traveling so not around, and I have a lot of great Goddess cards to add, so here are the first two sets - more to come as I get the piles of work under control around here.

These lovely soulful cards are from Angie/Alter My World, from Ontario, Canada:




and these fun cards are from Anu from Lake Park, FL, http://schnuckypuss.livejournal.com
(Yes - Star Trek's Uhuru is definately a goddess!)

When I get art from my friends in Russia, it always thrills and delights me. A wonderful artist, Valery Shimanovsky, is having his own mail art call for a small town - I will post the info here, but first, enjoy his work - the first is the envelope it all came in: Next is his submission for the Goddess call, which he had mailed and had been returned all the way from the U.S. Post Office: And a new submission called "renewing the American Goddess" with quotes from songs in English and Cyrillic from songs we all love: and finally a "gift" for me - a wonderful hand painted card saying hello from Russia. Please submit something to his mail call in honor of the 1000th birthday of his town, Yelabuga.
